segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate, and it’s like she’s in her own little world—it’s infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she doesn’t even seem to notice—how can she be so careless?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and that stool looks like it’s about to tip—someone needs to stop him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, hand out, like she’s waiting for a treat—doesn’t she see the danger?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to be ruined by the time she realizes what’s happening—it’s so frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out, and she doesn’t even flinch—it’s maddening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see the mess—probably not, knowing her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is making me so angry—I can’t stand how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand how unaware she is of everything around her—it’s unacceptable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to get hurt, and she won’t even know why—it’s her fault.
segments.speaker: PAR
